summary: This is a subpoena issued by the defense for Jeffrey Epstein in his criminal case, commanding the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Legal Department to produce all medical or mental health records relating to Epstein. The subpoena was requested by defense attorney Ruby J. Krajick and provides instructions for production and legal provisions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the subpoena for medical/mental health records; the defendant in criminal case 19-CRIM-00490.

persons.name: Ruby J. Krajick
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein who requested this subpoena for medical records.

connections.description: Ruby J. Krajick is listed as the attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein, who requests this subpoena.

events.title: Subpoena Production Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the Metropolitan Correctional Center to produce Jeffrey Epstein's medical or mental health records to defense counsel.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: Subpoena signed by the Clerk of Court commanding production of Epstein's medical records.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, Legal Department, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A subpoena was issued to obtain all medical or mental health records for Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The subpoena was requested by defense attorney Ruby J. Krajick on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein in criminal case 19-CRIM-00490.
The deadline for production was August 26, 2019, at 5:30 pm, with records to be mailed, emailed, or faxed to defense counsel.
The document references Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 17 provisions regarding motions to quash, service of subpoenas, and consequences for non-compliance.
The case number indicates this is from Epstein's 2019 federal criminal case in the Southern District of New York.
